text: Frankie Nolan (born 1950) is a former Irish sportsperson. He played hurling with his local club Patrickswell and with the Limerick senior inter-county team in the 1970s. He won an All Ireland medal in 1973 and was on the losing side n the final in 1974. He has the distinction of opening the scoring, with points from play, in both finals.
